name: Male child death rate (per 100,000)
description: Rates of child mortality by sex for selected causes of death in India. This is based on death rates per 100,000 for children aged 1-4 years old. This is given for a range of leading causes of death for comparison between infant mortality rates in males and females.
datasetName: Indian child mortality rate by gender

source.name: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation
source.dataPublishedBy: Global Burden of Disease Collaborative Network. Global Burden of Disease Study 2019 (GBD 2019) Results. Seattle, United States: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME), 2021.
source.dataPublisherSource: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation
source.additionalInfo:
Rates of child mortality by sex for selected causes of death in India. This is based on death rates per 100,000 for children aged 1-4 years old. This is given for a range of leading causes of death for comparison between infant mortality rates in males and females.

For conciseness and clarity, we have shortened a few of the original IHME causes of death:
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases: Liver diseases
Congenital birth defects = Birth defects
Congenital heart anomalies = Heart anomalies
Diabetes and kidney diseases = Kidney diseases
